genetic.framework.core

Class Individual

  • java.lang.Object
    • genetic.framework.core.Individual
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PathIndividual, WordIndividual

    public abstract class Individual
extends java.lang.Object
    Framework class for the individuals, i.e. any of the basic entities in the genetic algorithm model.
    Author:
    Ignacio Cuevas

    • Field Detail

      • genes

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> genes
        Genotype of the individual

      • numberOfGenes

        protected int numberOfGenes
        Number of genes. Defaults to 64, but may be set using the constructor that takes an integer as its argument.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Individual

        protected Individual(int numberOfGenes)
        Constructor for the class. Can only be called by child classes. Sets a number of genes and then generates them.
        Parameters:
        numberOfGenes - Number of genes for the individual.

      • Individual

        protected Individual()
        Constructor for the class. Can only be called by child classes. Generates the genes for the individual using the default amount of 64.

    • Method Detail

      • generateGenes

        private java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> generateGenes()
        Generates a set of genes for the individual.
        Returns:
        An integer list which contains the genes of the individual.

      • generateRandomGene

        public abstract java.lang.Integer generateRandomGene()
        Generates a random gene according to the individual implementation.
        Returns:
        A new, randomly generated gene represented as an integer.

      • uniformRate

        public double uniformRate()
        Crossover rate getter. Defaults to 50%, but may be overridden by child classes to modify it.
        Returns:
        Crossover rate value.

      • numberOfGenes

        public int numberOfGenes()
        Number of genes getter.
        Returns:
        Number of genes attribute.

      • mutationRate

        public double mutationRate()
        Mutation rate getter. Defaults to 0.15%, but may be overridden by child classes to modify it.
        Returns:
        Mutation rate value.

      • mutate

        public void mutate()
        Performs the mutation operation which is driven by the mutation rate. Used after crossover, when a new individual is generated.

      • childOf

        public void childOf(Individual father,
                    Individual mother)
        Performs the crossover operation. The arguments are the parents, while the receiver is their child. The child's genes are set according to the uniform rate.
        Parameters:
        father - Father for the crossover.
        mother - Mother for the crossover.

      • putGeneAt

        protected void putGeneAt(java.lang.Integer gene,
                         java.lang.Integer index)
        Sets a new gene in the specified position.
        Parameters:
        gene - Gene to be inserted.
        index - Position of the gene.

      • geneAt

        public java.lang.Integer geneAt(int index)
        Gets the gene located in the position specified by index.
        Parameters:
        index - Position of the gene.
        Returns:
        Gene located at position index.

      • fitness

        public int fitness(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> solution)
        Compute the fitness of an individual given the desired solution. The higher the number, the more fit the individual.
        Parameters:
        solution - The target for the genetic algorithm.
        Returns:
        Fitness of the individual.

      • genesAsString

        public java.lang.String genesAsString()
        Generates a text version of the genotype. Useful for debugging and testing purposes.
        Returns:
        A String representing the genotype.

      • getGenes

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getGenes()
        Genes getter. Used mostly for testing purposes.
        Returns:
        Genes attribute.
